content.text:
# East African Community Treaty

The treaty for the establishment of the East African  Community was signed on 30 November 1999. It entered into force on 7 July 2000 following its ratification by the original three  Partner States â€“ Kenya, Uganda and Tanzania. Rwanda and Burundi acceded to the treaty on 18 June 2007, and became full members of the community effective 1 July 2007. The accord established the East African Community whereby all participating nations agreed to establish more cooperative commercial and political relations for their cumulative 133 million citizens.
